info.name: z Unplanned Depreciation
info.description:
This collection has been forked from standard structure and contains an intial folder structure and examples to aid in creating the required postman tests. Some folders contain scripts that should not be modified and will be indicated at the biginning of the script.

This collection should be named to reflect the Integrator it is testing.

item.name: LOVs
Examples
REST Example

exec: // IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected results as a JSON object. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// NOTE: If the actual results change, make sure to analyse why they have changed before updating the expected results -
// - Simply overriding the expected results whenever the actual results change invalidates the test
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]

item.description:
This folder contains the tests for the REST column named.

A Search test is required if the column is searchable, otherwise a Shortlist test is required. Note that neither of these tests are required if the column is not 'Is Sheet Column'. These test simulate the form field.

Should the column have loose dependencies, the test above should include all dependent values. A second 'Search/Shortlist no loose dependencies' test should be created that has all loose dependency values removed.

A MultiRow test is required to simulate validation and should contain multiple validation values.

A Search test is required if the column is searchable, otherwise a Shortlist test is required. Note that neither of these tests are required if the column is not 'Is Sheet Column'. These test simulate the form field.

A MultiRow test is required to simulate validation and should contain multiple validation values.

item.description:
This folder contains examples for each type of LOV that can be duplicated as the starting point for your columns tests.

Do NOT duplicate this folder. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment. Instead, duplicate the required folder below this.

ie: either the REST or OBIEE Example

This folder must not be moved, renamed, or deleted.

exec: // IMPORTANT! When updating expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected results as a JSON object. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// NOTE: If the actual results change, make sure to analyse why they have changed before updating the expected results -
// - Simply overriding the expected results whenever the actual results change invalidates the test

const expectedResults = {"ITEMS":[{"LookupType":"ORA_WIS_WD_IMP_HEADER_ACTION","LookupCode":"CREATE","ViewApplicationId":0,"SetId":0,"Meaning":"Create","Description":"Action to add a new work definition.","EnabledFlag":"Y","StartDateActive":"1959-01-01","EndDateActive":null,"DisplaySequence":1,"CreatedBy":"SEED_DATA_FROM_APPLICATION","CreationDate":"2018-09-21T02:57:48.304+00:00","LastUpdatedBy":"SEED_DATA_FROM_APPLICATION","LastUpdateDate":"2024-10-24T08:27:34.190+00:00","LastUpdateLogin":"-1","Tag":null,"TrLookupType":null}]};

item.description:
This folder should contain sub-folders that replicate the Integrators Section structure. Each Section folder then has sub-folders for each Integrator Column, which then holds the specific request tests for that column.

This folder must not be moved, renamed, or deleted.

item.name: Downloads
Examples

// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE, REST, or SOAP
// REQUIRED: Define the expected query parameters. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]
// IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE, REST, or SOAP
// REQUIRED: Define the expected query parameters. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]
// IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected query parameters. This can be obtained from the console when first being run

// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]
// IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected query parameters. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]
// IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected query parameters. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>REPORT_PATH</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>%</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
          <!-- exclude all sections in one request -->
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>EXCLUDE__SECTION_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>Y</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>HAS__BRANCH_CRITERIA_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>N</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

item.description:
This folder contains examples for each type of Download that can be duplicated as the starting point for your download source tests.

Do NOT duplicate this folder. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment. Instead, duplicate the required folder below this.

ie: either the REST, Soap, or OBIEE Example

This folder must not be moved, renamed, or deleted.

header.description: Should be specified as '4' otherwise the default is specified per instance in a config file.

url.raw: {{ServerName}}/crmRestApi/resources/latest/lookups?onlyData=true&limit=1000&q=LookupType='FA_ASSET_TYPE' AND EnabledFlag='Y' AND (StartDateActive IS NULL OR StartDateActive <= '{{CurrentDate}}') AND (EndDateActive IS NULL OR EndDateActive >='{{CurrentDate}}') AND LookupCode IN('CIP','CAPITALIZED') AND (Meaning LIKE '%')

query.value: LookupType='FA_ASSET_TYPE' AND EnabledFlag='Y' AND (StartDateActive IS NULL OR StartDateActive <= '{{CurrentDate}}') AND (EndDateActive IS NULL OR EndDateActive >='{{CurrentDate}}') AND LookupCode IN('CIP','CAPITALIZED') AND (Meaning LIKE '%')

item.description:
This folder should contain sub-folders for each Download Source. Each Download Source folder then holds the specific request tests for that Download Source.

Create your download source folders by duplicating the specific folder from the Examples, rename the duplicate to your Source name, and move the new folder inside here.

item.name: Uploads
item.description: This folder contains all upload example payloads and responses. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment.

item.name: Miscellaneous
item.description: This folder contains any miscellaneous requests that may be useful. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment.

exec: * This script is used to run tests on the response of REST or OBIEE requests in Postman.
* - [2025-04-09] [ARN]: [Added 'LastUpdateDate','ETag' and 'links' to excludedKeys after reading the environment variable]
* - [2025-03-25] [ARN]: [Removed atob library and replaced with global atob function]
* - [2024-11-12] [ARN]: [Added excludedKeys functionality to prevent test failures when known data changes]
* - [2024-08-27] [ARN]: [Removed 'actual-only' styles from visualization when expected data is blank]
* - [2024-08-01] [ARN]: [Corrected visulaization error for REST responses that included null values]
* - [2024-07-31] [ARN]: [Simplified script by removing some visulization diff checking and consoldated LOV and Download into 1 script]
* 1. Paste this script against the collections folder Post-res script section.
* 2. Past the following against each requests Pre-req script section:
// IMPORTANT! When updating expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE, REST, or SOAP
// REQUIRED: Define the expected results as a JSON object. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// NOTE: If the actual results change, make sure to analyse why they have changed before updating the expected results -
// - Simply overriding the expected results whenever the actual results change invalidates the test
// Set the expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdatedBy","CurrentDate"]
// NOTE: the tags 'LastUpdateDate', 'Etag' and 'links' are added to these keys by the main script
* 3. Run the request and check the results in the Postman Visualize tab.
* 5. Update the expectedResults environment variable with the values from the console.
* 6. Should your data have changed, you can copy both the expectedResults and actualResults into a comparrison tool for analysis
if (requestType === "REST" || requestType === "OBIEE" || requestType === "SOAP" ) { // prevents this script from running if no requestType has been set
var expectedResults = pm.environment.get("expectedResults"); // Retrieve expected results from environment variable
var actualResults = extractResults(pm.response.text()); // Build actual results from response
// Test: Determine first section names and check if changed
pm.test("First section name has not changed", function() {
pm.test("No duplicate rows in the response", function() {
// Test: Compare the actual to expected results
pm.test("Actual result matches expected result", function() {
* Recursively removes specified keys from an object or array of objects.
* @param {Object|Array} obj - The object or array of objects to process.
* @param {Array<string>} excludedKeys - The keys to remove from the object.
* @returns {Object|Array} The processed object or array with specified keys removed.
if (Array.isArray(obj)) { // If obj is an array, apply the function to each element
return obj.map(item => removeKeys(item, excludedKeys)); // Map each element to the result of the function
} else if (typeof obj === 'object' && obj !== null) { // If obj is an object, remove excluded keys from it
return Object.keys(obj).reduce((acc, key) => { // Reduce the keys of the object
if (!excludedKeys.includes(key)) { // If the key is not in the excluded keys
acc[key] = removeKeys(obj[key], excludedKeys); // Add the key and the result of the function applied to its value to the new object
}, {}); // Initialize the accumulator as an object
} // If obj is not an array or object, return it as is
return obj; // Return the object with excluded keys removed
// Define CSS style sheet for visulization
const expectedKeys = (expectedResults ? [...new Set(getDeepKeys(expectedResults))] : {}); // Get the keys from the expected results, starting with the first data section
const actualKeys = [...new Set(getDeepKeys(actualResults))]; // Get the keys from the actual results, starting with the first data section
const keysWithClass = combineKeysWithPaths(expectedKeys, actualKeys); // Combine keys and assign a class to each
var responseTableHTML = styleSheet; // Add the style to the HTML
responseTableHTML += '<div class="tfcontainer">'; // Add a container div
responseTableHTML += createParametersTable(actualResults, expectedResults);// Add the parameters table
responseTableHTML += generateMissingTable(keysWithClass); // Add table of missing headings

responseTableHTML += '

Data:

'; // Add a header for the data table
responseTableHTML += '<table class="tftable">'; // Open the data table
var actualData = actualResults; // Get the actual data
var expectedData = expectedResults; // Get the expected data
responseTableHTML += createDataTable(keysWithClass, true, actualData[actualFirstSection], expectedData[expectedFirstSection]); // Add the data table
pm.visualizer.set(responseTableHTML); // Add the table to the Postman visualization tab
* Extracts results from a JSON or XML response based on the specified requestType.
* @throws {Error} - If there is an error extracting values from the response.
const xml2js = require('xml2js'); // Import xml2js library
if (requestType === "REST") { // Extract results from REST response JSON
if (JSON.parse(response).items) { // Check if response.items are found
actualResults = { ITEMS: items }; // Assign items to actualResults
} else { // Throw error if items are not found
throw new Error("extractResults: Error extracting values from REST response"); // Throw error
} else if (requestType === "SOAP"){ // default to OBIEE, extract reportBytes and decode it
xml2js.parseString(response, { explicitArray: false }, (err, responseJson) => { // Parse XML to JSON
if (err) { // Throw error if there is an error parsing XML
throw new Error("extractResults: Error parsing SOAP response: " + err); // Throw error
throw new Error("extractResults: 'ns1:Value' not found in SOAP response"); // Throw error
actualResults = { ITEMS: result }; // Assign items to actualResults
} else if (requestType === "OBIEE"){ // default to OBIEE, extract reportBytes and decode it
xml2js.parseString(response, { explicitArray: false }, (err, responseJson) => { // Parse XML to JSON
if (err) { // Throw error if there is an error parsing XML
throw new Error("extractResults: Error parsing OBIEE response: " + err); // Throw error
var reportBytes = responseJson['env:Envelope']['env:Body']['ns2:runReportResponse']['ns2:runReportReturn']['ns2:reportBytes']; // Extract reportBytes from JSON
xml2js.parseString(atob(reportBytes), { explicitArray: false }, (err, result) => { // Decode reportBytes and parse it to JSON
if (err) { // Throw error if there is an error decoding XML
throw new Error("extractResults: Error decoding XML: " + err); // Throw error
actualResults = result.DATA_DS; // Assign result to actualResults
* Finds and returns the value of a given target key in a nested object.
* @param {object} obj - The object to search in.
* @param {string} targetKey - The target key to find.
* @returns {*} - The value of the target key if found, otherwise null.
for (let key in obj) { // Iterate over each key in the object
if (key === targetKey) { // If the key is the target key
return obj[key]; // Return the value of the target key
} // Otherwise, if the value of the key is an object, recursively search for the target
if (typeof obj[key] === 'object' && obj[key] !== null) { // If the value is an object
const result = findObject(obj[key], targetKey); // Recursively search for the target key in the value
if (result) { // If the target key is found in the value
return result; // Return the value of the target key
} // Otherwise, continue to the next key
} // If the value is not an object, continue to the next key
return null; // Return null if the target key is not found
* Removes keys with a dollar sign ($) from the given object recursively.
* If the object is an array, it applies the removal to each element.
* @param {Object|Array} obj - The object to remove dollar keys from.
* @returns {Object|Array} - The object with dollar keys removed.
if (Array.isArray(obj)) { // If obj is an array, apply the function to each element
return obj.map(removeDollarKeys); // Map each element to the result of the function
} else if (typeof obj === 'object' && obj !== null) { // If obj is an object, remove dollar keys from it
const newObj = {}; // Create a new object to store the result
for (let key in obj) { // Iterate over each key in obj
if (key !== '$') { // If the key is not a dollar sign
newObj[key] = removeDollarKeys(obj[key]); // Add the key and the result of the function applied to its value to the new object
return newObj; // Return the new object with dollar keys removed
} // If obj is not an array or object, return it as is
return obj; // Return the object with dollar keys removed
* Creates a parameters table based on the provided JSON data and expected JSON.
* @param {Object} jsonActual - The actual JSON data object.
* @param {Object} jsonExpected - The expected JSON data object.
* @returns {string} - The HTML string representing the parameters table.
let hasParameters = false; // Create a flag to check if there are any parameters

let html = '

Parameters:

'; // Add a header for the parameters table
if (requestType === "REST") { // Extract parameters from REST response JSON
html += '<table class="tftable"><tr>'; // Start the table and headings row
let dataRow = '<tr>'; // Start the data row
for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(jsonExpected)) { // Iterate over the expected data to create headings and data rows
hasParameters = true; // Set the flag to true
if (typeof value !== 'object') { // Check if the value is not an object
html += `<th class="both">${key}</th>`; // Add a cell to the headings row for each key
if (value !== jsonActual[key]) { // Check if the values do not match

dataRow += `[EXPECTED] ${value}
[ACTUAL] ${jsonActual[key]}`; // Add a cell to the data row with a class for different values
dataRow += `${value}`; // Add a cell to the data row for matching values
for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(jsonActual)) { // Iterate over the actual data to check for new keys
if (!jsonExpected || !jsonExpected.hasOwnProperty(key)) { // Check if the expected does not have the key
hasParameters = true; // Set the flag to true
html += `<th class="` + (jsonExpected ? '">':'actual-only">[NEW] ')+ `${key}</th>`; // Add a cell to the headings row for each missing key
dataRow += `${value}`; // Add a cell to the data row with a class for expected-only values
html += '' + dataRow + ''; // Close the headings row and add the data row
return hasParameters ? html : ''; // Return the HTML string if there are parameters, otherwise return an empty string
* Generates a response table HTML of columns missing from the expected results.
* @param {Object} keysWithClass - The keys with class object.
const expectedOnlyHeaders = Object.entries(keysWithClass) // Get the headers and their classes
.filter(([header, value]) => value.style === "expected-only") // Filter out the headers that are not expected-only
.map(([header]) => `<th class="expected-only">${header}</th>`) // Generate the HTML for the expected-only headers
.join(""); // Join the HTML for the expected-only headers
if (expectedOnlyHeaders.length > 0) { // If there are expected-only headers

html += '

Missing columns:

'; // Add a header for the missing columns

html += `${expectedOnlyHeaders}

`; // Add a table with the expected-only headers
* Retrieves all the deep keys of an object along with their paths.
* @param {Object} obj - The object to retrieve the deep keys from.
* @param {string} [path=''] - The current path of the object (used internally for recursion).
* @param {boolean} [firstObj=true] - Indicates whether the current object is the first object (used internally for recursion).
* @returns {Array} - An array of objects containing the deep keys and their paths.
let keys = []; // Initialize an empty array to store the keys
for (let key in obj) { // Iterate over each key in the object
const newPath = path ? `${path}.${key}` : key; // Create a new path
if (typeof obj[key] === 'object') { // Check if the current key is an object
keys = keys.concat(getDeepKeys(obj[key], newPath, false)); // Concatenate the keys from the recursive call
} else if(!firstObj) { // Check if the current object is not the first object
keys.push({ key, path: newPath }); // Add the current key along with its path
return keys; // Return the array of keys
* Finds the first key in an object that has a value of type 'object'.
* @param {Object} obj - The object to search for the first key.
* @returns {string|undefined} - The first key with a value of type 'object', or undefined if no such key is found.
for (let key in obj) { // Iterate over each key in the object
if (typeof obj[key] === 'object') { // Check if the current key is an object
return key; // Return the key if it is an object
* Combines expected keys and actual keys into a single object, indicating whether each key is present in both, expected-only, or actual-only.
* @param {Array<{ key: string, path: string }>} expectedKeys - An array of objects representing the expected keys and their corresponding paths.
* @param {Array<{ key: string, path: string }>} actualKeys - An array of objects representing the actual keys and their corresponding paths.

* @returns {Array<{ key: string, paths: Array<string>, value: string }>} - An array of objects containing the combined keys, their paths, and their value indicating whether they are present in both, expected-only, or actual-only.
const combinedKeys = {}; // Object to store the combined keys
expectedKeys.forEach(({ key, path }) => { // Loop through the expected keys
combinedKeys[key] = combinedKeys[key] || { paths: [], style: 'expected-only' }; // Initialize the key if it doesn't exist
combinedKeys[key].paths.push(path); // Add the path to the key
actualKeys.forEach(({ key, path }) => { // Loop through the actual keys
if (combinedKeys[key]) { // If the key exists in the combined keys
} else { // If the key doesn't exist in the combined keys
combinedKeys[key] = { paths: [path], style: (expectedKeys.length > 0 ? 'actual-only':'') }; // Initialize the key with the value 'actual-only'
combinedKeys[key].paths.push(path); // Add the path to the key
return Object.entries(combinedKeys).reduce((acc, [key, { paths, style }]) => { // Convert the object to an array
acc[key] = { key, paths, style }; // Convert the array to an object
}, {}); // Initialize the accumulator as an object
* Checks if there are duplicate rows in the given array of items.
* @param {Array} items - The array of items to check for duplicate rows.
* @returns {boolean} - Returns true if duplicate rows are found, false otherwise.
var uniqueRows = new Set(); // Set to store unique rows
var hasDuplicates = false; // Flag to indicate if duplicate rows are found
if (!Array.isArray(items)) { // Convert items to an array if it is not already an array
items = [items]; // Convert items to an array
items.forEach(item => { // Iterate over each item in the array
var row = JSON.stringify(item); // Convert the item to a string
if (uniqueRows.has(row)) { // Check if the row is already present in the set
hasDuplicates = true; // Set the flag to true
console.log("Duplicate row found: ", row); // Log the duplicate row
} else { // If the row is not present in the set
uniqueRows.add(row); // Add the row to the set
return hasDuplicates; // Return true if duplicate rows are found, false otherwise
* Creates a data table based on the actual data and expected data.
* @param {Array|Object} actualData - The actual data to be displayed in the table.
* @param {Object} expectedData - The expected data used for comparison.
* @returns {string} - The HTML string representing the data table.
// let html = '<table class="tftable">'; // Start the table
if (Array.isArray(actualData)) { // Check if the actual data is an array
if (expectedData && !Array.isArray(expectedData)) { // Check if the expected data is not an array
throw new Error("createDataTable: actual and expected data structures are too different"); // Throw error
} else{ // If the expected data is an array
// let actualHeaders = Object.keys(actualData[0]); // Get the headers from the first item in the array
let actualRows = Object.values(actualData); // Get the actual values from the object
actualRows.forEach((actualRow, row) => { // Iterate over the rows
var expectedRow = expectedData[row]; // Get the expected item
html += createDataTable(headers,printHeaders,actualRow,expectedRow); // Add a cell for the new section
printHeaders = false; // Set printHeaders to false
html += createDataTable(headers,printHeaders,actualRow); // Add a cell for the new section
printHeaders = false; // Set printHeaders to false
} else if (typeof actualData === 'object') { // Check if the actual data is an object
let actualHeaders = Object.keys(actualData); // Get the headers from the object
let actualValues = Object.values(actualData); // Get the actual values from the object
if (printHeaders) { // Check if printHeaders is true
html += '<tr>'; // Start a new row for the headers
html += `<th class="${headers[header] ? `${headers[header].style} ` : ''}sticky">${header}</th>`; // Add a cell for each header
printHeaders = false; // Set printHeaders to false
html += '<tr>'; // Start a new row for the data
actualValues.forEach((actualItem, index) => { // Iterate over the values
var expectedItem = (expectedData ? expectedData[actualHeaders[index]] : ''); // Get the expected item
if (typeof actualItem !== 'object' || actualItem === null) { // Check if the item is not an object
if (expectedData) { // Check if there is expected data
if (!expectedData.hasOwnProperty(actualHeaders[index])) { // Check if the header is not in expectedData
html += `[UNEXPECTED] ${actualItem}`; // Add a cell with class for actual-only headers
} else if (expectedItem !== actualItem) { // Check if the actual item is not equal to the expected item

html += `[ACTUAL] ${actualItem}
[EXPECTED] ${expectedItem}`; // Add a cell with class for different values
} else { // If the value is in expectedData
html += `${actualItem}`; // Add a cell for each value
} else { // If there is no expected data
html += `${actualItem}`; // Add a cell for each value
} else if(actualItem !== null) { // If the item is an object
if (expectedItem) { // Check if there is an expected item

html += `${createDataTable(headers,true,actualItem,expectedItem)}
`; // Add a cell for the new section
} else { // If there is no expected item

html += `${createDataTable(headers,true,actualItem)}
`; // Add a cell for the new section with no expected data
return html; // Return the HTML string
